definitions: natural hot spring that intermittently erupts jets of water and steam into the air
examples: Old Faithful geyser erupts approximately every ninety minutes
The tourists gathered around the geyser waiting for the spectacular eruption

definitions: butter that has been melted and clarified for cooking, especially in South Asian cuisine
examples: She cooked the curry using fragrant ghee instead of oil
Traditional Indian sweets often require pure ghee for authentic flavor

definitions: poor urban area occupied primarily by a minority group
any segregated mode of living or working that results from bias or stereotyping
examples: The family struggled to leave the ghetto for better opportunities
Many immigrants initially settled in the ghetto before moving elsewhere
The tech industry creates its own ghetto of like-minded professionals
Academic departments sometimes become intellectual ghettos isolated from other disciplines

definitions: spirit or soul of a dead person believed to appear to the living
faint trace or possibility of something
person who secretly does work for another person who gets the credit
examples: The old mansion was supposedly haunted by several ghosts
Children dressed as ghosts for the Halloween celebration
There wasn't a ghost of a chance they would win
Only a ghost of her former smile remained
The celebrity hired a ghost to write her autobiography
Many politicians use ghosts for their important speeches

definitions: professional writer who creates content officially credited to another person
examples: The politician's memoir was actually written by a professional ghostwriter
Many celebrities employ ghostwriters to pen their autobiographies

definitions: evil spirit or phantom that robs graves and feeds on corpses
person who delights in the revolting, morbid, or loathsome
examples: Ancient Arabic tales warned of ghouls lurking in graveyards
The horror movie featured ghouls rising from their tombs
The reporters acted like ghouls, hovering around the accident scene
Some people become ghouls, obsessed with true crime stories

definitions: imaginary or mythical being of human form but superhuman size
unusually large person, animal, plant, or thing
person or thing of extraordinary power, significance, or importance
examples: Jack climbed the beanstalk and encountered a fearsome giant
Norse mythology tells of giants who battled the gods
The California redwoods are giants of the plant kingdom
The tech company became a giant in the industry
Einstein was an intellectual giant of the twentieth century
She stood among giants in her field of research

definitions: rapid, unintelligible talk or writing that appears to be nonsense
examples: The toddler spoke excited gibberish that only she understood
The corrupted file displayed nothing but gibberish on the screen

definitions: small, slender tree-dwelling ape with long arms native to forests of Southeast Asia
examples: Gibbons swing gracefully through the rainforest canopy using their long arms
The zoo's gibbon exhibit features several species from Southeast Asia

definitions: item given willingly to someone without payment or expectation of return
natural ability or talent that seems to come without effort
examples: She wrapped the birthday gift in colorful paper and ribbon
The charity received generous gifts from anonymous donors
Her gift for languages allowed her to master five by age twenty
The child showed a remarkable gift for mathematics

definitions: live performance by a musician or band, especially in popular music
temporary or freelance job or assignment
light two-wheeled carriage pulled by one horse
examples: The band played their first gig at a local coffee shop
She booked several gigs for the summer music festival
He took programming gigs to pay for college expenses
The freelancer juggled multiple gigs to make ends meet
The museum displayed a Victorian gig in pristine condition
They rode through the park in an antique gig

definitions: unit of information equal to one billion bits, used in data transmission
examples: The new internet plan offers gigabit speeds for streaming
Modern networks transmit data at multiple gigabits per second

definitions: unit of computer memory or data storage equal to approximately one billion bytes
examples: The smartphone has sixty-four gigabytes of internal storage
The video file was several gigabytes in size

definitions: man who is paid to be a companion or escort to wealthy women
examples: The novel featured a gigolo who fell for one of his clients
She suspected the young man was a gigolo targeting wealthy widows

definitions: thin layer of gold or gold-colored material applied to a surface
process or art of applying gold leaf or gold paint to something
examples: The antique frame retained its original gilding despite its age
Careful restoration revealed beautiful gilding beneath layers of paint
The artisan specialized in gilding religious artifacts and furniture
Traditional gilding requires patience and delicate handwork

definitions: respiratory organ in fish and other aquatic animals for extracting oxygen from water
unit of liquid measure equal to a quarter of a pint
examples: Fish breathe by passing water over their gills to extract oxygen
The shark's gills flapped as it swam through the coral reef
The old recipe called for a gill of cream
Bartenders once measured spirits by the gill

definitions: thin coating of gold or something that looks like gold
young female pig, especially one that has not yet given birth
examples: The picture frame featured ornate gilt decoration around the edges
Years of handling had worn away much of the gilt
The farmer separated the gilts from the rest of the herd
Several gilts were selected for breeding next season

definitions: clever or novel device, scheme, or stratagem designed to attract attention or increase appeal
examples: The store's free gift gimmick attracted many new customers
Critics dismissed the movie's 3D effects as a cheap gimmick

definitions: clear alcoholic spirit distilled from grain and flavored with juniper berries
machine for separating cotton fibers from their seeds
form of rummy card game for two players
examples: She ordered a gin and tonic with extra lime
The bartender recommended their house-made botanical gin
Whitney's cotton gin revolutionized the textile industry
The old plantation museum displayed an antique cotton gin
They played gin rummy every Sunday afternoon
Grandpa taught me the rules of gin when I was ten

definitions: hot fragrant spice made from the rhizome of a plant, used in cooking and medicine
light reddish-yellow or orange-brown color
spirit, liveliness, or vigor
examples: Fresh ginger adds warmth to the stir-fry dish
She drank ginger tea to soothe her upset stomach
The cat had beautiful ginger fur with white patches
She dyed her hair a vibrant ginger shade
The new manager brought much-needed ginger to the department
Add some ginger to your presentation to keep people engaged

definitions: cake or cookie made with ginger and typically molasses or honey
elaborate or excessively ornate decoration, especially in architecture
examples: Children decorated gingerbread houses for the holiday contest
The bakery's gingerbread cookies filled the shop with spicy aroma
The Victorian house featured elaborate gingerbread trim on the porch
Critics called the building's gingerbread decoration excessive and tasteless

definitions: deciduous Chinese tree with fan-shaped leaves, cultivated as an ornamental and for medicinal use
examples: The ginkgo trees turn brilliant yellow every autumn
Ginkgo extract is marketed as a memory-enhancing supplement

definitions: plant root used in herbal medicine, believed to boost energy and have restorative properties
examples: Korean ginseng tea is prized for its health benefits
The herbalist recommended ginseng for increased vitality and focus

definitions: member of a traditionally itinerant people, now considered an outdated and offensive term
examples: Historical records document gipsy caravans traveling through the region
The term gipsy is now widely considered inappropriate and offensive

definitions: African mammal with an extremely long neck and legs, the tallest living terrestrial animal
examples: The giraffe stretched its neck to reach leaves high in the acacia tree
Baby giraffes drop six feet to the ground at birth

definitions: large iron or steel beam used as a main support in building or bridge construction
examples: Steel girders formed the skeleton of the new skyscraper
The bridge's massive girders spanned the entire river

definitions: woman's elasticated corset worn around the waist and hips
something that surrounds or encircles like a belt
examples: Women in the 1950s often wore girdles for a slim silhouette
The vintage shop displayed antique girdles and corsets
A girdle of mountains surrounded the ancient valley
The equator forms an imaginary girdle around Earth

definitions: female child from birth to adulthood
young or relatively young woman
examples: The little girl played with her dolls in the garden
Their daughter was a bright, curious girl
The girls from the office went out for drinks after work
She remained friends with the girls from college

definitions: regular female companion with whom a person has a romantic or sexual relationship
woman's female friend
examples: He introduced his girlfriend to his parents at dinner
They had been girlfriend and boyfriend for three years
She went shopping with her girlfriends on Saturday
My girlfriend from work gives the best advice

definitions: time or state of being a girl, the period of a female's youth
examples: She spent her girlhood on a farm in rural Vermont
Memories of her girlhood came flooding back when she visited

definitions: measurement around the middle of something, especially a person's waist
strap that passes under a horse's belly to secure a saddle
examples: The ancient tree had a girth of over twenty feet
The doctor measured the patient's waist girth for health assessment
She tightened the girth before mounting her horse
The saddle's girth needed adjustment for the smaller pony

definitions: substance or essence of a speech, text, or matter; the main point
examples: She captured the gist of the argument in three sentences
I didn't understand everything, but I got the general gist

definitions: capacity to bend or alter in shape under pressure; elasticity
examples: The rope had enough give to absorb the shock
Good leather shoes have some give after wearing them

definitions: thing that is given free, especially for promotional purposes
thing that makes something obvious or reveals something unintentionally
examples: The store offered product giveaways to attract customers
Radio stations often have ticket giveaways for concerts
His nervous laugh was a dead giveaway that he was lying
The expensive watch was a giveaway that she wasn't really poor

definitions: established fact or situation that is accepted as true
specified or stated item or condition
examples: It's a given that prices will rise with inflation
Her talent was a given in the music industry
Work within the givens of the problem to find solutions
The mathematical givens must be clearly stated

definitions: person who gives something, especially one who gives generously or habitually
examples: She was known as a generous giver to local charities
The anonymous giver donated millions to the hospital

definitions: practice or quality of being generous and providing gifts or help to others
examples: The season of giving brings out the best in people
Her spirit of giving inspired others to volunteer

definitions: muscular stomach in birds and some other animals used for grinding food
examples: Chickens use their gizzard to grind grain with small stones
The turkey's gizzard is considered a delicacy in some cuisines

definitions: process or result of being covered by glaciers or ice sheets during geological periods
examples: Evidence of ancient glaciation appears in the mountain valleys
The last major glaciation ended about ten thousand years ago

definitions: slowly moving mass or river of ice formed by accumulation and compaction of snow
examples: The glacier carved deep valleys as it moved through the mountains
Climate change causes glaciers to retreat at alarming rates

definitions: open space in a forest or woods, typically grassy and without trees
examples: Sunlight streamed into the peaceful glade surrounded by tall oaks
The deer grazed quietly in the forest glade

definitions: armed combatant who entertained audiences in the Roman Republic and Empire by fighting
examples: Roman gladiators fought to the death in the Colosseum
The movie portrayed the brutal life of a gladiator

definitions: attractive or exciting quality that makes certain people or things seem appealing
enchantment or magic spell, especially one cast by witches
examples: Hollywood stars embodied the glamour of the golden age
The fashion show captured the glamour of Parisian haute couture
Old folktales spoke of fairies casting glamour to deceive mortals
The witch's glamour made the cottage appear as a palace

definitions: brief or hurried look at something or someone
examples: She stole a glance at her watch during the meeting
A quick glance revealed nothing unusual about the document

definitions: organ in the body that synthesizes and releases substances for use or elimination
examples: The thyroid gland regulates metabolism through hormone production
Swollen glands often indicate an infection in the body

definitions: strong, dazzling light that causes discomfort to the eyes
fierce or angry stare directed at someone
examples: The glare from the snow made it hard to see
Sunglasses reduced the glare from the water's surface
She fixed him with an icy glare across the room
The teacher's glare silenced the chattering students

definitions: Soviet policy of open discussion of political and social issues instituted by Mikhail Gorbachev
examples: Glasnost allowed unprecedented criticism of the Soviet government
The era of glasnost marked significant change in Soviet society

definitions: building with glass walls and roof for growing plants that need protection from weather
examples: The botanical garden's glasshouse contains tropical plants year-round
Tomatoes grew abundantly in the heated glasshouse

definitions: ornaments and articles made from glass, especially drinking glasses and tableware
examples: The restaurant uses fine crystal glassware for special occasions
She carefully packed the antique glassware for the move

definitions: group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often associated with increased eye pressure
examples: Regular eye exams can detect glaucoma before vision loss occurs
The doctor prescribed drops to manage her glaucoma
